intro: Jasione sessiliflora var. megalocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered jasione, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas or rocky habitats.
